channel.title: PacketFabric on PacketFabric Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in PacketFabric on PacketFabric Documentation

item.title: 1. Select the Package
2. Select Source Port Market
item.description: Start by choosing a source port from any of our locations. Here, we’ll choose Chicago. There are multiple Chicago options; we’ll select Coresite CH1 in Chicago: Once we select Chicago and Coresite CH1, we see the below screen. The green checkmark overlay indicates that we have successfully chosen our Source Port Market and Site. We can now select available source port details. We’ll choose the 10Gbps/LR radio button:

item.title: 3. Select Destination Port Market
item.description: We’ll now choose our destination port; let’s select Los Angeles: Once we’ve chosen a city we’re again presented with a list of available sites. We’ll select Equinix LA1: We again see the green checkmark, confirming that this selection has successfully completed. Notice that as we advance through each step in the process, we get continuous and cumulative feedback on our selections. We can at any time revise any of these selections by clicking CHANGE SOURCE LOCATION, CHANGE SOURCE DETAILS, CHANGE DESTINATION LOCATION.

item.title: 4. Activate The Service
item.description: Once our PacketDirect service is finished provisioning, we generate the Letters of Authorization (LOAs). We do that by clicking on the three dots on the far right-hand side and choosing ‘generate LOA:’ We’ll now choose to: Generate the LOA for both sides at the same time, without selecting the option to email as an attachment Change who the LOA is made out to. (If, for instance we’re known as a different name at a facility we can go ahead and enter that name, as we’ve done below – “Brand X.
